today_in_history_posts.title: Why not archive the backend of Bitcoin blockchain?
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Kulpreet Singh queries if lightning nodes need only monitor post-funding transactions.
- Singh questions the viability of indexing on pruned bitcoind for lightning purposes.
- Discussion extends to saving blockchain chunks on minimal computers to aid users with limited storage.

today_in_history_posts.title: Rebalancing argument
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The post analyzes the effectiveness of cycle transactions for Lightning Network rebalancing.
- It mentions discussions on mechanisms like Revive for network rebalancing.
- The benefit of rebalancing on network liquidity and fee strategies is questioned.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin scaling proposes 50,000 off-chain entities to handle transactions for 1 billion users weekly.
- Innovative coinpools and semi-trusted services could increase scalability while maintaining Bitcoin's core values.
- Development focuses on preventing correlated failures and ensuring regulatory compliance through networking off-chain entities.
